docs.title: AI Agents: An Overview
docs.text: AI agents are autonomous computational entities that perform tasks on behalf of users or other systems. They operate by leveraging artificial intelligence (AI) to make decisions, learn from data, and interact with their environment.

docs.title: Definition and Characteristics
docs.text:
• Autonomy: AI agents can perform tasks without human intervention.
  • Reactivity: They perceive their environment and respond in a timely fashion.
  • Proactivity: AI agents do not merely act in response; they can take initiative based on goals.
  • Social Ability: They communicate with other agents, systems, or humans to complete tasks.

docs.title: Types of AI Agents
docs.text:
• Simple Reflex Agents: Act based on current perception without considering the rest of the perceptual history.
  • Model-Based Reflex Agents: Have an internal state to track the world and act accordingly.
  • Goal-Based Agents: Act to achieve their goals and can adapt their actions accordingly.
  • Utility-Based Agents: Aim to maximize their utility, evaluating the best option among many.
  • Learning Agents: Adapt and improve their performance over time through learning mechanisms.

docs.title: Perception
docs.text: Agents perceive their environment through sensors or data input, which informs their decisions and actions.

docs.title: Decision-Making
docs.text: AI agents use algorithms to make decisions. Techniques include: - Machine Learning (ML) - Decision Trees - Neural Networks - Rule-Based Systems

docs.title: Learning
docs.text: Agents improve over time using various learning methods: - Supervised Learning - Unsupervised Learning - Reinforcement Learning

docs.title: Action
docs.text: Agents act using effectors or through interfacing with other systems, executing tasks autonomously.

docs.title: Generative AI Agents
docs.text: Generative AI agents can create new content or solutions: - Natural Language Processing (NLP): Generating human-like text. - Computer Vision: Creating or editing images and videos. - Data Synthesis: Generating synthetic data for training other AI models.

docs.title: Integration and Deployment
docs.text:
• APIs and Services: AI agents can be accessed via APIs or hosted services.
  • Edge Computing: Deploying agents on edge devices for low-latency applications.
  • Cloud Platforms: Leveraging scalable cloud resources for complex computations.

docs.title: Ethical Implications
docs.text: The autonomy of AI agents raises questions about ethical design, biases, and decision-making accountability.

docs.title: Privacy and Security
docs.text: Agents that process sensitive data must adhere to privacy regulations and robust security protocols.

docs.title: Future of Work
docs.text: AI agents could automate tasks, enhancing productivity, but also potentially displacing certain job functions.

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
AI agents represent a significant advancement in how we interact with and leverage technology, with the potential to revolutionize various industries by automating complex tasks, providing insights from large datasets, and enabling new forms of content creation.

For comprehensive information and advanced topics, refer to the additional sections and resources.

docs.title: Common Features between Agents and Assistants
docs.text:
• Both utilize Large Language Models (LLMs).
  • Both operate based on prompts for direction.
  • Both have access to files and tools.
  • Both can be interacted with via UI or code.

docs.title: Agents
docs.text:
• Nature: Autonomous.
  • Scope: Narrow.
  • Functionality:
  • Agents can have multiple classes and tools plus a knowledge base, giving them the ability to generalize or focus given the exact prompt.
  • Used in conjunction with other agents (referred to as "crews", "swarms", etc.).
  • Agent Frameworks:
  • CrewAI
  • Autogen
  • Langchain
  • Ideal Use Cases:
  • Complex processes that require skills from a few specialist agents to be effective.
  • High latency activities.

docs.title: Assistants
docs.text:
• Nature: Human-assisted.
  • Scope: Mid to narrow.
  • Functionality:
  • Stand-alone operation.
  • Assistant Platforms:
  • OpenAI Assistants API
  • SuperAGI
  • Ease of Building:
  • Easy to build with access to building blocks.
  • Ideal Use Cases:
  • Focused, narrow scope processes that only need a few skills, abilities, and knowledge sources.
  • Low latency activities.

docs.text: • ESG Reporting Gap Analysis.

docs.title: AI Assistants: An Overview
docs.text: AI Assistants are sophisticated software entities that leverage artificial intelligence to interact with users, perform tasks, understand and generate natural language, and provide assistance across a range of activities.

docs.title: Defining AI Assistants
docs.text:
• Interactivity: AI Assistants can engage in two-way communication, understanding user input and responding coherently.
  • Contextual Understanding: They interpret the context of inquiries or tasks to provide relevant responses or assistance.
  • Task Execution: Capable of performing a variety of tasks, from scheduling to data retrieval, based on user commands.

docs.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
docs.text:
• Language Models: Use large-scale models like GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) for understanding and generating language.
  • Entity Recognition: Identify and extract relevant entities from natural language input.

docs.title: Machine Learning and Adaptation
docs.text:
• Personalization: Learn from user interactions to tailor responses and actions.
  • Predictive Modeling: Anticipate user needs based on patterns and preferences.

docs.title: Integration
docs.text:
• API Connectivity: Interact with external databases, services, and applications through APIs.
  • Cross-Platform Support: Function across various devices and platforms.

docs.title: Conversational Abilities
docs.text:
• Dialogue Management: Maintain coherent and contextually relevant conversations.
  • Multi-Turn Interaction: Handle ongoing interactions over multiple exchanges.

docs.title: Task Automation
docs.text:
• Workflow Automation: Streamline repetitive tasks and workflows.
  • Information Retrieval: Fetch and present information based on queries.

docs.title: Content Creation
docs.text:
• Text Generation: Craft emails, reports, code, and more.
  • Creative Content: Generate creative writing, such as poetry or stories.

docs.title: OpenAI Assistants API
docs.text: KPMG Auditchat is currently implementing OpenAI's Assistants API so users can interact with pre-built assistants. Future features will include the ability for end users to build their own assistants and store them for future use, and share them amongst peers.

docs.title: AI and Human Collaboration
docs.text:
• Augmented Productivity: Assistants amplify human capabilities in various domains.
  • Human-AI Interaction: Research into more intuitive ways for humans to interact with AI.

docs.title: Advancements in AI
docs.text:
• Model Improvements: Ongoing advancements in model architecture and training for enhanced performance.
  • Ethical AI: Focus on developing responsible and transparent AI systems.

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
AI Assistants, powered by advanced AI algorithms and capable of sophisticated interactions, are becoming an integral part of personal and professional environments, providing users with a powerful tool for communication and automation.

Refer to additional documentation for specific use cases, advanced configurations, and API references to harness the full potential of AI Assistants in your applications.

docs.title: Understanding Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
docs.text: Convolutional Neural Networks, or CNNs, stand as a cornerstone in the field of deep learning, particularly excelling in pattern recognition and object identification tasks. This document, presented by Martin Keane from the IBM garage, aims to demystify CNNs and illustrate their incredible potential across various applications.

docs.title: What is a CNN?
docs.text: At its core, a Convolutional Neural Network is a deep learning algorithm that can take in an input image, assign importance (learnable weights and biases) to various aspects/objects in the image, and be able to differentiate one from the other. The preprocessing required in a CNN is much lower as compared to other classification algorithms. While in primitive methods filters are hand-engineered, with enough training, CNNs have the ability to learn these filters/characteristics.

docs.title: The Structure of a CNN
docs.text:
• Neural Networks: CNNs are built on the foundation of artificial neural networks, consisting of multiple interconnected layers. Each layer transforms its input and passes the result to the next layer.
  • Filters: Key to CNNs are filters within layers that perform pattern recognition. These filters are capable of identifying simple shapes and textures in the initial layers, progressing to complex objects in deeper layers.

docs.title: How CNNs Work
docs.text:
The operation of CNNs can be distilled into several fundamental steps:

  1. Receiving Input: The process begins with an image, broken down into a matrix of pixels.
  2. Applying Filters: Filters, or kernels, move across the image (a process known as convolution) to identify patterns. Each filter is designed to detect a specific type of feature at this stage.
  3. Pooling: After convolution, the dimensionality of the image is reduced using pooling (usually max pooling), retaining the most essential information.
  4. Repeating: The process of convolution and pooling is repeated through multiple layers, with each layer capable of recognizing more complex patterns.
  5. Fully Connected Layers: Towards the end, CNNs use fully connected layers where the high-level reasoning about the image takes place, leading to the final classification or recognition task.

docs.title: Applications of CNNs
docs.text:
CNNs find their applications in a wide array of fields, proving their versatility and effectiveness:

  • Optical Character Recognition (OCR): For interpreting handwritten texts and documents.
  • Visual Recognition: Including facial recognition, object detection, and classification tasks.
  • Medical Imaging: Assisting in the diagnosis by analyzing complex imagery such as MRIs and CT scans.
  • Visual Search: Enhancing search capabilities by using images as queries instead of text.

Convolutional Neural Networks have revolutionized the way computers see and understand our world, from simple pattern recognition to complex image analysis in healthcare and beyond.

docs.title: Transformers
docs.text: Transformers are a groundbreaking architecture in deep learning that have revolutionized the way we approach sequence-to-sequence tasks. They are widely used in natural language processing (NLP) but are also applicable in other domains.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Transformers were introduced in the paper "Attention is All You Need" by Vaswani et al. in 2017. Unlike previous sequence models that relied on recurrent or convolutional layers, Transformers use a mechanism called "self-attention" to process sequences of data.

docs.title: Self-Attention
docs.text: The self-attention mechanism allows the model to weigh the importance of different parts of the input data. It's what enables the Transformer to understand the context and the relationships between words or elements in a sequence.

docs.title: Positional Encoding
docs.text: Since Transformers do not inherently handle the order of the sequence data, positional encodings are added to give the model information about the position of the elements in the sequence.

docs.title: Multi-Head Attention
docs.text: Multi-head attention is an extension of the self-attention mechanism, allowing the model to focus on different parts of the sequence simultaneously, providing a richer understanding of the context.

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
A typical Transformer model has an encoder-decoder structure:

  • Encoder: Processes the input sequence and generates a context-rich representation.
  • Decoder: Takes the encoded data and generates the output sequence, step by step.

Each encoder and decoder is composed of multiple layers that include self-attention and feedforward neural network sublayers.

docs.title: Applications
docs.text:
Transformers have been applied successfully in many NLP tasks, including:

  • Machine Translation
  • Text Summarization
  • Question Answering
  • Text Generation

They are also being explored in other areas such as:

  • Image Recognition
  • Music Generation

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
The Transformer model has become a key component in state-of-the-art NLP systems. Its effectiveness and efficiency have paved the way for more advanced models like GPT-4, BERT, and others, which have further pushed the boundaries of what's possible in AI.

For more detailed information on Transformers and their applications, consider reading the original paper or exploring the vast amount of resources available online.

docs.title: Understanding Large Language Models (LLMs)
docs.text: Generative Pre-trained Transformer, or GPT, represents a significant advancement in AI technology, offering the ability to generate human-like text. This guide delves into the fundamentals of LLMs, their working mechanism, and their practical applications in the auditing domain.

docs.title: What is a Large Language Model?
docs.text:
A Large Language Model (LLM) is a type of foundation model designed to process and understand text data at a large scale. Foundation models are characterized by their training on extensive datasets, allowing them to produce adaptable and generalizable outputs. LLMs specialize in textual data, including written content like books, articles, and even code.

  • Size and Scale: LLMs are distinguished by their vast data requirements, often encompassing petabytes of text. To illustrate, a single gigabyte can hold approximately 178 million words, and LLMs like GPT-3 are trained on datasets as large as 45 terabytes.

  • Parameters: The complexity of an LLM is indicated by its parameter count, with GPT-3 boasting 175 billion machine learning parameters, with GPT4-Turbo reportedly being trained on 1.7 Trillion parameters!

docs.title: How LLMs Work
docs.text:
Understanding LLMs involves three key components:

  1. Data: The extensive text data that serves as the foundation for training.
  2. Architecture: LLMs utilize neural networks, specifically the transformer architecture, to process sequences of data efficiently. This structure excels in understanding context and relationships within sentences.
  3. Training: Through training, an LLM learns to predict subsequent words in a sentence, refining its predictions over time to generate coherent text. Fine-tuning on specific datasets further enhances its accuracy for particular tasks.
  4. Inference: After training, the model uses its learned parameters to generate or interpret new text. In this phase, the LLM applies its training to perform specific tasks or answer queries with minimal additional input.

docs.title: Audit Applications of LLMs
docs.text:
In the audit sector, LLMs offer innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and accuracy:

  • Automated Compliance Checks: LLMs can assist in reviewing and interpreting complex regulatory documents to ensure compliance with the latest standards and laws.
  • Risk Assessment: By analyzing vast amounts of financial documents, LLMs can help identify potential risks and anomalies that warrant closer inspection.
  • Report Generation: LLMs can automate the creation of detailed audit reports, summarizing findings and recommendations with high accuracy and coherence.
  • Continuous Auditing: Leveraging LLMs for continuous auditing allows for real-time pulls of audit procedure source documents for automated audit pipelines. Enhancing the ability to detect and address issues early in the audit.

The integration of LLMs into auditing processes signifies a leap forward in the field, offering the potential for significant improvements in both efficiency and effectiveness.

docs.title: Understanding the Random Forest Algorithm
docs.text: The Random Forest algorithm is a widely used machine learning technique that builds on the simplicity of decision trees and enhances their performance by combining multiple trees into a "forest". This guide aims to break down the Random Forest algorithm, how it works, and where it can be applied effectively.

docs.title: What is Random Forest?
docs.text: Random Forest is an ensemble learning method for classification, regression, and other tasks. It operates by constructing a multitude of decision trees at training time and outputting the class that is the mode of the classes (classification) or mean prediction (regression) of the individual trees.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Ensemble Method: By combining the predictions of multiple decision trees, it reduces the risk of overfitting and often results in improved accuracy.
  • Versatility: Effective for both categorical and numerical data, making it applicable to a wide range of tasks.
  • Handling Missing Values: Capable of handling missing data by maintaining accuracy even when a significant portion of the data is missing.

docs.title: How Random Forest Works
docs.text:
The process of training a Random Forest model involves several key steps:

  1. Bootstrap Aggregating (Bagging): Random Forest uses the bagging technique, where multiple subsets of the dataset are randomly sampled with replacement to train each decision tree independently, increasing the diversity of the models.
  2. Feature Randomness: When splitting a node during the construction of the tree, the choice of the split is made from a random subset of the features, rather than the best split among all features. This further increases model diversity and reduces overfitting.
  3. Prediction:
  4. For classification, the prediction is made by majority vote from all the trees.
  5. For regression, it averages the predictions from all trees.

docs.title: Applications of Random Forest
docs.text:
Due to its robustness and ease of use, Random Forest is applied across a vast spectrum of domains:

  • Banking: For identifying loan risk and detecting fraudulent activity.
  • Medicine: For predicting diseases and customizing treatment plans based on patient history.
  • E-commerce: For recommending products based on customer behavior and preferences.
  • Environmental Science: For classifying the type of land cover and predicting forest fires.

Random Forest stands out as a powerful tool in the machine learning toolbox, offering a strong balance between simplicity and performance across various types of data and applications.

docs.title: File Upload
docs.text: The File Upload feature in GPT-4 chat offers users the ability to provide GPT-4 with direct access to text files, enhancing interactions by grounding conversations in specific document content. This guide details how to use the feature, its applications, and best practices.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
• Functionality: Users can upload text files (.txt, .pdf, etc.) directly into the chat interface. GPT-4 processes the content of these files to answer questions, provide insights, or generate text based on the uploaded document.
  • Supported Formats: Primarily supports plain text (.txt) and PDF (.pdf) files. For optimal performance, it is recommended to use text files whenever possible due to their straightforward processing.

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Initiating Upload: Click on the upload button (paperclip icon) in the chat interface.
  2. Selecting File: Choose a text or PDF file from your device. There might be a file size limit, ensuring quick processing and response times.
  3. Processing: After upload, GPT-4 reads the document and incorporates its content into the conversation context.
  4. Interaction: Users can then ask questions or request actions based on the content of the uploaded file.

docs.title: Applications
docs.text:
• Data Analysis: Summarize or analyze key points from reports, articles, or research papers.
  • Educational Support: Provide study materials for tutoring or explanations on specific topics.
  • Creative Assistance: Generate ideas or continue stories based on provided narratives.
  • Professional Tasks: Draft emails, reports, or documents by referencing uploaded materials.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Clear Context: When asking questions related to the uploaded file, provide clear context to ensure accurate responses.
  • Privacy: Avoid uploading sensitive or personal information, as GPT-4 processes data based on its training and operational guidelines, ensuring user privacy and data protection.
  • File Preparation: Ensure files are well-structured and predominantly text-based to aid GPT-4 in effectively processing and understanding the content.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• Understanding Limits: GPT-4's understanding is based on the content of the uploaded file and its pre-existing knowledge. Complex or highly specialized documents may pose challenges.
  • File Size and Type: There are limitations on the size and types of files that can be uploaded, affecting the versatility of the feature.

The File Upload feature significantly enhances GPT-4's utility by enabling direct reference to document content, opening up a wide range of applications from educational aid to professional document analysis. By following the outlined best practices, users can leverage this feature to its full potential, enriching their interaction with GPT-4.

docs.title: GPT-4
docs.text: OpenAI's GPT-4, the latest iteration of the Generative Pre-trained Transformer models, brings a host of features and functionalities designed to cater to a wide range of applications, from conversational agents to complex problem-solving tasks. This document highlights the key features and functionalities that GPT-4 offers to its users.

docs.title: Enhanced Language Understanding and Generation
docs.text:
• Deep Contextual Comprehension: GPT-4 exhibits a profound understanding of context, allowing it to maintain coherent and relevant responses over extended conversations.
  • Advanced Text Generation: Capable of generating highly natural, diverse, and contextually appropriate text, making it suitable for creative writing, content creation, and more.

docs.title: Broad Knowledge Base
docs.text:
• Extensive Knowledge: GPT-4 has been trained on a vast corpus of text, enabling it to access a wide range of information across numerous domains.
  • Real-time Learning: While GPT-4 does not learn from interactions in real-time, its training includes up-to-date information available up to its last update, ensuring it has current knowledge up to that point.

docs.title: Versatile Interaction Styles
docs.text:
• Multiple Languages: GPT-4 supports text generation and understanding in multiple languages, making it a powerful tool for global communication.
  • Adjustable Tone and Style: Users can specify the tone, style, and format of GPT-4's responses, allowing for customization to suit different needs and preferences.

docs.title: Practical Applications Support
docs.text:
• Problem Solving: GPT-4 can assist in solving complex problems by providing explanations, solutions, and recommendations based on its vast knowledge base.
  • Education and Learning: Offers tutoring and explanatory capabilities in various subjects, making it an invaluable resource for learners.
  • Programming Assistance: Capable of understanding and generating code snippets in several programming languages, aiding in software development and debugging.

docs.title: Enhanced Creativity and Design
docs.text:
• Creative Writing: Assists users in generating creative content, including stories, poems, and dialogue.
  • Idea Generation: GPT-4 can help brainstorm ideas for projects, business strategies, and creative pursuits.

docs.title: Integration and Development Tools
docs.text:
• API Access: Developers can integrate GPT-4 into their applications through OpenAI's API, allowing for the creation of custom solutions and enhancements.
  • Customization and Fine-tuning: Although direct fine-tuning is not typically available for individual users, GPT-4's versatile interaction model allows for pseudo-customization through careful prompting.

docs.title: Ethical and Safe Interactions
docs.text:
• Content Filtering: Implements measures to prevent the generation of unsafe or harmful content, aligning with OpenAI's commitment to ethical AI development.
  • Privacy and Security: Ensures user data privacy and security, with strict policies in place to protect sensitive information.

docs.title: Example Prompt Template (Sales Cutoff)
docs.text:
This is an example of a prompt that can be used for sales cutoff testing. If the user has selections in csv or excel format, they should convert to markdown table format (use AuditChat to do this) if there are just a few transactions, then insert them directly into the prompt.

If user has a dataset of transactions in csv or excel file, then upload the file and in the ## Dataset section and reference the attached file as the source of data to interpolate.

docs.title: Sales Cutoff Prompt Template (input)
docs.text:
# Sales Cutoff Audit Procedure
This is your prompt to complete the Sales Cutoff Audit Procedure. Follow all instructions below. Read the instructions carefully, if you complete the procedure correctly I will reward you with a $10,000 performance bonus!

The objective of this audit procedure is to ensure that sales transactions are recorded in the correct accounting period. This involves validating each transaction against shipping documents and sales invoices to ensure the timing of revenue recognition is accurate and complies with accounting principles.

## Dataset
| Transaction ID | Date       | Description          | Amount (USD) | Customer Name | Invoice Number | Shipping Date |
|----------------|------------|----------------------|--------------|---------------|----------------|---------------|
| S0001          | 2024-01-10 | Product Sale         | 1500.00      | Acme Corp     | INV-S1001      | 2024-01-19    |
| S0002          | 2024-01-15 | Consultation Fee     | 3000.00      | Beta LLC      | INV-S1002      | 2024-01-14    |
| S0003          | 2024-01-20 | Maintenance Service  | 750.00       | Gamma Inc     | INV-S1003      | 2024-01-29    |
| S0004          | 2024-01-25 | Software License     | 1200.00      | Delta Ltd     | INV-S1004      | 2024-01-24    |
| S0005          | 2024-02-01 | Hardware Sale        | 2200.00      | Epsilon AB    | INV-S1005      | 2024-01-30    |
| S0006          | 2024-02-05 | Subscription Renewal | 600.00       | Zeta Inc      | INV-S1006      | 2024-02-04    |

## Steps to Follow

For each transaction in the dataset, perform the following steps:

1. **Retrieve Transaction Details:** For transaction ID `{transaction_id}`, review the transaction details including date, description, amount, customer name, invoice number, and shipping date.

2. **Verify Shipping Date:** Ensure that the shipping date is on or before the invoice date to confirm the transaction belongs in the recorded period.

3. **Documentation:** Document any discrepancies found between the shipping dates and invoice dates, detailing any corrective actions taken.

4. **Cutoff Compliance:** Assess whether each transaction complies with the cutoff criteria, marking compliance or noting any discrepancies.

## Testing Instructions

To validate the accuracy of the sales cutoff process, select all transaction and interpolate their details using the following format:

- **Transaction ID:** `{transaction_id}`
- **Date:** `{date}`
- **Description:** `{description}`
- **Amount:** `${amount}`
- **Customer Name:** `{customer_name}`
- **Invoice Number:** `{invoice_number}`
- **Shipping Date:** `{shipping_date}`

Replace the placeholders with actual data from the transaction you are auditing. This step ensures a thorough review of each transaction against the cutoff criteria.

### Example

For transaction ID S0003, the interpolation would look like:

- **Transaction ID:** `S0003`
- **Date:** `2024-01-20`
- **Description:** `Maintenance Service`
- **Amount:** `$750.00`
- **Customer Name:** `Gamma Inc`
- **Invoice Number:** `INV-S1003`
- **Shipping Date:** `2024-01-19`

Proceed with the sales cutoff audit as outlined, ensuring that each step is thoroughly documented and validated.

## Output Deliverable
Document your findings in a markdown table format for review.

docs.title: Sales Cutoff Prompt Template (output)
docs.text:
To perform the Sales Cutoff Audit Procedure as described, I'll review each transaction in the provided dataset to ensure compliance with the cutoff criteria. Specifically, I'll check if the shipping date for each transaction is on or before the invoice date, which is crucial for accurate revenue recognition according to accounting principles. Here are the findings documented in the requested markdown table format:

| Transaction ID | Date       | Description          | Amount (USD) | Customer Name | Invoice Number | Shipping Date | Compliance | Notes                                             |
|----------------|------------|----------------------|--------------|---------------|----------------|---------------|------------|---------------------------------------------------|
| S0001          | 2024-01-10 | Product Sale         | 1500.00      | Acme Corp     | INV-S1001      | 2024-01-19    | No         | Shipping date is after invoice date.              |
| S0002          | 2024-01-15 | Consultation Fee     | 3000.00      | Beta LLC      | INV-S1002      | 2024-01-14    | Yes        | Shipping (service completion) before invoice date.|
| S0003          | 2024-01-20 | Maintenance Service  | 750.00       | Gamma Inc     | INV-S1003      | 2024-01-29    | No         | Shipping date is after invoice date.              |
| S0004          | 2024-01-25 | Software License     | 1200.00      | Delta Ltd     | INV-S1004      | 2024-01-24    | Yes        | Shipping (license activation) before invoice date.|
| S0005          | 2024-02-01 | Hardware Sale        | 2200.00      | Epsilon AB    | INV-S1005      | 2024-01-30    | Yes        | Shipping date is before invoice date.             |
| S0006          | 2024-02-05 | Subscription Renewal | 600.00       | Zeta Inc      | INV-S1006      | 2024-02-04    | Yes        | Shipping (subscription renewal activation) before invoice date.|

Findings and Actions:
S0001 and S0003 show discrepancies where the shipping dates are after the invoice dates, which does not comply with the cutoff criteria for revenue recognition in the correct accounting period.
Corrective Actions: It is recommended to adjust the accounting records to reflect these transactions in the period when the goods were actually shipped or services were completed to ensure compliance with revenue recognition principles.
This table ensures each transaction has been thoroughly reviewed against the cutoff criteria, detailing compliance and noting any discrepancies along with recommended corrective actions.

docs.title: Why This Format of Prompt Is a Smart Approach
docs.text: This format of prompt is smart because it provides a clear, structured approach to handling a complex task. By breaking down the audit procedure into detailed steps and providing a specific format for documenting findings, it ensures thoroughness and accuracy in the audit process. This structured approach helps in minimizing errors and omissions, as the large language model not only gains context from the text in the prompt but also from the markdown syntax it is written in. Moreover, the prompt's detailed instructions empower users with varying levels of expertise to understand and complete the task accurately.

docs.title: Review Note Improver Template
docs.text: This template is designed to guide users in transforming their audit file review notes into clearer, more actionable, and professionally polished insights. Leveraging advanced NLP techniques, this template facilitates the refinement of review notes to meet professional auditing standards.

docs.title: Objective
docs.text: The primary aim is to aid auditors and audit teams in elevating the quality of their review notes. By doing so, we strive to enhance audit quality and efficiency, fostering better communication and comprehension among team members.

docs.title: How to Use the Template
docs.text:
The template serves as a framework for inputting original audit file review notes and receiving an improved version. The enhancement process includes:

  • Clarity and Readability: Making the note easier to understand.
  • Technical Accuracy: Ensuring all technical points are correct.
  • Key Findings: Highlighting the most important points and recommendations.
  • Conciseness: Removing unnecessary information.
  • Professional Tone: Adopting a formal and professional language style.

docs.title: Prompt Format
docs.text:
To utilize this template effectively, submit your original audit file review note in the following markdown format:

# Original Review Note:
> {>>Insert your original review note here<<}

## Instructions for Improvement of {original}:
- Enhance clarity and conciseness.
- Ensure technical accuracy.
- Highlight key findings and recommendations.
- Remove any redundant or non-essential information.
- Maintain a professional tone.

### Examples
[
  {
    "original": "This section could be better. Please check.",
    "improved": "This section would benefit from more detailed examples to support the audit findings. Could you please elaborate further for clarity?"
  },
  {
    "original": "Kind of confusing. Might want to look at it again.",
    "improved": "The argument presented in this section is somewhat unclear. Revising for coherence and adding supporting data could enhance its effectiveness."
  }
]

docs.title: Improved Review Note Example (input)
docs.text:
# Original Review Note:
